sentences: Sabas olid mustade seas mõned valged jõhvid.
Juksed olid karedad ja jämedad nagu jõhvid.
context: The word 'jõhv' in Estonian refers to coarse, thick, and strong horsehair or the mane/tail hair of a horse used as material for brushes, upholstery, or other purposes. It can also refer to similar stiff-haired materials. The word appears in various contexts including describing physical characteristics (coarse like jõhvi) and industrial/material uses (töökoda ostab jõhv - workshop buys horsehair).
